name: Hồ Xuân Hương
highlight: 6km paved loop at 1,480m — the lakeside mist at 6am is worth every early alarm. Fully runnable on road shoes, mostly flat. Cooldown bánh mì at the Trần Phú stalls right after.

name: Vườn Hoa Thành Phố Đà Lạt
highlight: The city's iconic flower park overlooking Xuan Huong Lake. Features hundreds of flower species including hydrangeas, orchids, and roses perfectly curated.

name: Đỉnh núi Langbiang
highlight: 860m vert in 8km — the toughest line in the CP12 trail guide. Pick up the GPX at reception. The plateau at 2,167m runs faster than it looks from below.

name: Chợ đêm thành phố Đà Lạt
highlight: Post-run recovery done right: warm soy milk, bánh tráng nướng, and fresh local strawberries. Walk through the bustling stalls to soak in the evening atmosphere.

name: Đồi chè Cầu Đất Đà Lạt
highlight: A century-old tea plantation at 1,650m. Perfect for early morning cloud 'hunting' and strolling through the endless curved rows of green tea bushes.

name: Thiền viện Trúc Lâm Đà Lạt
highlight: Take the cable car up; earn the 4km pine-trail descent back to town. Fully runnable with switchbacks — time it early morning before tour groups hit the trail.
